title: Modeling a Periodic Context - Electric Fan Part A

content.question: Part A The graph of \(h\) and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, \(F\), \(G\), \(J\), \(K\), and \(P\), are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented. Determine possible coordinates <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>h</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8A@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for the five points: \(F\), \(G\), \(J\), \(K\), and \(P\) . Moving from left to right: Point F is at a maximum point. Point G is on the midline. Point J is at a minimum point. Point K is on the midline. Point P is at a maximum point.

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
